meanings.definition: A container, typically a jug or pail, used for carrying beer.
meanings.sent1: I brought two growlers of beer to the party.
meanings.sent2: The brewery sells growlers for customers to fill with their favorite brews.
meanings.sent3: The growlers clinked together in the backseat as we drove to the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The growlers lined up on the shelf like soldiers ready for battle.
meanings.sent5: The growlers, with their amber glass and metal caps, looked like treasure chests filled with liquid gold.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that growls.
meanings.sent1: The dog's deep growlers warned us to stay away.
meanings.sent2: The growlers in the dark alley made me walk faster.
meanings.sent3: The growlers at the zoo were surprisingly good singers.
meanings.sent4: His stomach growlers during the quiet meeting were quite embarrassing.
meanings.sent5: The growlers of the thunderstorm kept us awake all night.

meanings.definition: A wave breaking into foam along a shore.
meanings.sent1: The growlers crashed against the rocks, sending spray into the air.
meanings.sent2: Surfers love riding the growlers at this beach.
meanings.sent3: The growlers whispered secrets to the seashells on the sand.
meanings.sent4: The growlers danced gracefully before dissolving into white foam.
meanings.sent5: The growlers roared like lions as they approached the shore.
